column5: Last weekend before winterizing my ride. Was out this afternoon for couple hours north end of Pigeon 1 dink on bottom bouncer in 30 ft. Water temp 50 F Does anybody know where they are this time of year? And what works?

I stopped fishing the kawarthas in the fall captain.  I have lived on Pigeon for over 30 years and fished it longer.  We used to do great in the fall fishing weed lines and any moving water using jigs with minnows.  That all seemed to change when the zebra mussels showed up. I guess I just didn't adjust to the changes.  Deeper water is where I would try, but it's a little far for me to travel by boat to get to the deep water.  I do believe that minnows are the trick.
Night time off shore with shallow running cranks or minnows.
As of tomorrow I'm off for a few days and can gladly join you to help try and find them.  *just saying  *
Try where you got those crappies we talked about. I've caught tons there at night.  S.
Ill be on the Trent river for the weekend! If anyone wants to come out there's lots of room in the boat..Just north of Campbellford on hwy 50..
Try where you got those crappies we talked about. I've caught tons there at night.  S. Oh I may go tonight

Night time for 90% catches this time of year. Off my dock jointed J9 long.cast x raps produce well LITE float and minnows if I want.to relax and.tip a few back. There.right. on shore looking for frogs minnows.
This is my modus operandi for tomorrow night ?
